intro: Comarostaphylis chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spineless stems and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, round fruits that contain edible seeds. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
